review: Very excited to receive the Fire TV stick. I have a Chromecast and was interested in the use of the remote as my Nexus 5 battery seems to drain quickly even without use (Thanks for the Lollipop update Google!).Pros:Fire TV Stick provides a rich platform built on Android that allows playing video and music right from your Amazon account. Previously I was using PS3 to access prime videos because of the lack of Amazon Video support for Chomecast.Fire TV Stick also has app integration direct from the Amazon Android Appstore. You can play games or interact with other video platforms such as Netflix, Crackle. TwitTV, Hulu Plus, etc. (This is similar to Roku). Furthermore, the platform is fairly open allowing for "side-loading" apps such as XBMC (which provides better video streaming support for other media formats).Cons:There are stability problems with applications and the rest of the platform. For example, Crackle will randomly open while watching Netflix and start playing content. ESPN will crash when network goes out.There is no built in application to stream local media on the network.
